name: site_identifiers
comment: Links local site identifiers to their corresponding site.

columns.name: si_type
columns.comment: local key type, ie 'interwiki' or 'langlink'

columns.name: si_key
columns.comment: local key value, ie 'en' or 'wiktionary'

columns.name: si_site
columns.comment: Key on sites.site_id

name: updatelog
comment: A table to log updates, one text key row per update.

name: actor
comment: The "actor" table associates user names or IP addresses with integers for the benefit of other tables that need to refer to either logged-in or logged-out users. If something can only ever be done by logged-in users, it can refer to the user table directly.

columns.name: actor_id
columns.comment: Unique ID to identify each actor

columns.name: actor_user
columns.comment: Key to user.user_id, or NULL for anonymous edits

columns.name: actor_name
columns.comment: Text username or IP address

name: user_former_groups
comment: Stores the groups the user has once belonged to. The user may still belong to these groups (check user_groups). Autopromotion of users to groups from which they were removed can be restricted by using wgAutopromoteOnce instead of wgAutopromote.

columns.name: ufg_user
columns.comment: Key to user_id

name: bot_passwords
comment: This table contains a user's bot passwords: passwords that allow access to the account via the API with limited rights.

columns.name: bp_user
columns.comment: User ID obtained from CentralIdLookup.

columns.name: bp_app_id
columns.comment: Application identifier.

columns.name: bp_password
columns.comment: Password hashes, like user.user_password.

columns.name: bp_token
columns.comment: Like user.user_token

columns.name: bp_restrictions
columns.comment: JSON blob for MWRestrictions

columns.name: bp_grants
columns.comment: Grants allowed to the account when authenticated with this bot-password

name: comment
comment: Edits, blocks, and other actions typically have a textual comment describing the action. They are stored here to reduce the size of the main tables, and to allow for deduplication. Deduplication is currently best-effort to avoid locking on inserts that would be required for strict deduplication. There MAY be multiple rows with the same comment_text and comment_data.

columns.name: comment_id
columns.comment: Unique ID to identify each comment

columns.name: comment_hash
columns.comment: Hash of comment_text and comment_data, for deduplication

columns.name: comment_text
columns.comment: Text comment summarizing the change. This text is shown in the history and other changes lists, rendered in a subset of wiki markup by MediaWiki\CommentFormatter\CommentFormatter::format(). Size limits are enforced at the application level, and should take care to crop UTF-8 strings appropriately.

columns.name: comment_data
columns.comment: JSON data, intended for localizing auto-generated comments. This holds structured data that is intended to be used to provide localized versions of automatically-generated comments. When not empty, comment_text should be the generated comment localized using the wiki's content language.

name: slots
comment: Slots represent an n:m relation between revisions and content objects. A content object can have a specific "role" in one or more revisions. Each revision can have multiple content objects, each having a different role.

columns.name: slot_revision_id
columns.comment: reference to rev_id or ar_rev_id

columns.name: slot_role_id
columns.comment: reference to role_id

columns.name: slot_content_id
columns.comment: reference to content_id

columns.name: slot_origin
columns.comment: The revision ID of the revision that originated the slot's content. To find revisions that changed slots, look for slot_origin = slot_revision_id. TODO: Is that actually true? Rollback seems to violate it by setting slot_origin to an older rev_id. Undeletions could result in the same situation.

indexes.name: slot_revision_origin_role
indexes.comment: Index for finding revisions that modified a specific slot

name: site_stats
comment: Contains a single row with some aggregate info on the state of the site.

columns.name: ss_row_id
columns.comment: The single row should contain 1 here.

columns.name: ss_total_edits
columns.comment: Total number of edits performed.

columns.name: ss_good_articles
columns.comment: See SiteStatsInit::articles().

columns.name: ss_total_pages
columns.comment: Total pages, theoretically equal to SELECT COUNT(*) FROM page.

columns.name: ss_users
columns.comment: Number of users, theoretically equal to SELECT COUNT(*) FROM user.

columns.name: ss_active_users
columns.comment: Number of users that still edit.

columns.name: ss_images
columns.comment: Number of images, equivalent to SELECT COUNT(*) FROM image.

name: user_properties
comment: User preferences and perhaps other fun stuff. :) Replaces the old user.user_options blob, with a couple nice properties: 1) We only store non-default settings, so changes to the defaults are now reflected for everybody, not just new accounts. 2) We can more easily do bulk lookups, statistics, or modifications of saved options since it's a sensible table structure.

columns.name: up_user
columns.comment: Foreign key to user.user_id

columns.name: up_property
columns.comment: Name of the option being saved. This is indexed for bulk lookup.

columns.name: up_value
columns.comment: Property value as a string.

columns.name: ls_field
columns.comment: The type of ID (rev ID, log ID, rev timestamp, username)

columns.name: ls_value
columns.comment: The value of the ID

columns.name: ls_log_id
columns.comment: Key to log_id

name: change_tag
comment: A table to track tags for revisions, logs and recent changes

columns.name: ct_rc_id
columns.comment: RCID for the change

columns.name: ct_log_id
columns.comment: LOGID for the change

columns.name: ct_rev_id
columns.comment: REVID for the change

columns.name: ct_params
columns.comment: Parameters for the tag; used by some extensions

columns.name: ct_tag_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to change_tag_def row

indexes.name: ct_tag_id_id
indexes.comment: Covering index, so we can pull all the info only out of the index.

name: content
comment: The content table represents content objects. It's primary purpose is to provide the necessary meta-data for loading and interpreting a serialized data blob to create a content object.

columns.name: content_id
columns.comment: ID of the content object

columns.name: content_size
columns.comment: Nominal size of the content object (not necessarily of the serialized blob)

columns.name: content_sha1
columns.comment: Nominal hash of the content object (not necessarily of the serialized blob)

columns.name: content_model
columns.comment: reference to model_id. Note the content format isn't specified; it should be assumed to be in the default format for the model unless auto-detected otherwise.

columns.name: content_address
columns.comment: URL-like address of the content blob

name: l10n_cache
comment: Table for storing localisation data

columns.name: lc_lang
columns.comment: Language code

columns.name: lc_key
columns.comment: Cache key

columns.name: lc_value
columns.comment: Value

name: redirect
comment:
For each redirect, this table contains exactly one row defining its target.
Redirect targets are key to page_namespace/page_title of the target page.
The target page may or may not exist, and due to renames
and deletions may refer to different page records as time
goes by.

columns.name: rd_from
columns.comment: Key to the page_id of the redirect page

columns.name: rd_interwiki
columns.comment: After T346290 all values have been computed and this field is never null. TODO: Mark as not null (T348029).

columns.name: rd_fragment
columns.comment: After T346290 all values have been computed and this field is never null. TODO: Mark as not null (T348029).

name: pagelinks
comment: Track page-to-page hyperlinks within the wiki. The target page may or may not exist, and due to renames and deletions may refer to different page records as time goes by.

columns.name: pl_from
columns.comment: Key to the page_id of the page containing the link.

columns.name: pl_from_namespace
columns.comment: Namespace for pl_from page

columns.name: pl_target_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to linktarget.lt_id

indexes.name: pl_target_id
indexes.comment: Reverse index, for Special:Whatlinkshere

indexes.name: pl_backlinks_namespace_target_id
indexes.comment: Index for Special:Whatlinkshere with namespace filter

name: templatelinks
comment: Track template inclusions. The target page may or may not exist, and due to renames and deletions may refer to different page records as time goes by.

columns.name: tl_from
columns.comment: Key to the page_id of the page containing the link.

columns.name: tl_from_namespace
columns.comment: Namespace for this page

columns.name: tl_target_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to linktarget.lt_id

indexes.name: tl_target_id
indexes.comment: Reverse index, for Special:Whatlinkshere

indexes.name: tl_backlinks_namespace_target_id
indexes.comment: Index for Special:Whatlinkshere with namespace filter

name: existencelinks
comment: Track dependencies on the existence of a target page, like #ifexist

columns.name: exl_from
columns.comment: page_id of the referring page

columns.name: exl_target_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to linktarget.lt_id

indexes.name: exl_target_id
indexes.comment: Reverse index, for triggering cache updates

name: imagelinks
comment: Track links to images *used inline* We don't distinguish live from broken links here, so they do not need to be changed on upload/removal.

columns.name: il_from
columns.comment: Key to page_id of the page containing the image / media link.

columns.name: il_from_namespace
columns.comment: Namespace for this page

columns.name: il_to
columns.comment: Filename of target image. This is also the page_title of the file's description page; all such pages are in namespace 6 (NS_FILE).

indexes.name: il_to
indexes.comment: Reverse index, for Special:Whatlinkshere and file description page local usage

indexes.name: il_backlinks_namespace
indexes.comment: Index for Special:Whatlinkshere with namespace filter

name: langlinks
comment: Track interlanguage links.

columns.name: ll_from
columns.comment: page_id of the referring page

columns.name: ll_lang
columns.comment: Language code of the target

columns.name: ll_title
columns.comment: Title of the target, including namespace

indexes.name: ll_lang
indexes.comment: Index for ApiQueryLangbacklinks

name: iwlinks
comment: Track inline interwiki links

columns.name: iwl_from
columns.comment: page_id of the referring page

columns.name: iwl_prefix
columns.comment: Interwiki prefix code of the target

columns.name: iwl_title
columns.comment: Title of the target, including namespace

indexes.name: iwl_prefix_title_from
indexes.comment: Index for ApiQueryIWBacklinks

name: category
comment: Track all existing categories. Something is a category if 1) it has an entry somewhere in categorylinks, or 2) it has a description page. Categories might not have corresponding pages, so they need to be tracked separately. The numbers of member pages (including categories and media), subcategories, and Image: namespace members, respectively are included in this table too.  These are signed to make underflow more obvious.  We make the first number include the second two for better sorting: subtracting for display is easy, adding for ordering is not.

columns.name: cat_id
columns.comment: Primary key

columns.name: cat_title
columns.comment: Name of the category, in the same form as page_title (with underscores). If there is a category page corresponding to this category, by definition, it has this name (in the Category namespace).

indexes.name: cat_pages
indexes.comment: For Special:Mostlinkedcategories

name: watchlist_expiry
comment: Allows setting an expiry for watchlist items.

columns.name: we_item
columns.comment: Key to watchlist.wl_id

columns.name: we_expiry
columns.comment: Expiry time

name: change_tag_def
comment: Table defining tag names for IDs. Also stores hit counts to avoid expensive queries on change_tag

columns.name: ctd_id
columns.comment: Numerical ID of the tag (ct_tag_id refers to this)

columns.name: ctd_name
columns.comment: Symbolic name of the tag (what would previously be put in ct_tag)

columns.name: ctd_user_defined
columns.comment: Whether this tag was defined manually by a privileged user using Special:Tags

columns.name: ctd_count
columns.comment: Number of times this tag was used

name: ipblocks_restrictions
comment: Partial Block Restrictions

columns.name: ir_ipb_id
columns.comment: The bl_id from block

columns.name: ir_type
columns.comment: The restriction type id.

columns.name: ir_value
columns.comment: The restriction id that corresponds to the type: page ID, namespace ID or BlockActionInfo ID.

indexes.name: ir_type_value
indexes.comment: Index to query restrictions by the page or namespace.

name: querycache
comment: Used for caching expensive grouped queries

columns.name: qc_type
columns.comment: A key name, generally the base name of the special page

columns.name: qc_value
columns.comment: Some sort of stored value. Sizes, counts...

name: querycachetwo
comment: Used for caching expensive grouped queries that need two links (for example double-redirects)

columns.name: qcc_type
columns.comment: A key name, generally the base name of the special page.

columns.name: qcc_value
columns.comment: Some sort of stored value. Sizes, counts...

name: page_restrictions
comment: Used for storing page restrictions (i.e. protection levels)

columns.name: pr_id
columns.comment: Field for an ID for this restrictions row (sort-key for Special:ProtectedPages)

columns.name: pr_page
columns.comment: Page to apply restrictions to (Foreign Key to page).

columns.name: pr_type
columns.comment: The protection type (edit, move, etc)

columns.name: pr_level
columns.comment: The protection level (Sysop, autoconfirmed, etc)

columns.name: pr_expiry
columns.comment: Field for time-limited protection.

name: user_groups
comment: User permissions have been broken out to a separate table; this allows sites with a shared user table to have different permissions assigned to a user in each project. This table replaces the old user_rights field which used a comma-separated blob.

columns.name: ug_user
columns.comment: Key to user_id

columns.name: ug_group
columns.comment: Group names are short symbolic string keys. The set of group names is open-ended, though in practice only some predefined ones are likely to be used. At runtime $wgGroupPermissions will associate group keys with particular permissions. A user will have the combined permissions of any group they're explicitly in, plus the implicit '*' and 'user' groups.

columns.name: ug_expiry
columns.comment: Time at which the user group membership will expire. Set to NULL for a non-expiring (infinite) membership.

name: querycache_info
comment: Details of updates to cached special pages

columns.name: qci_type
columns.comment: Special page name. Corresponds to a qc_type value

columns.name: qci_timestamp
columns.comment: Timestamp of last update

columns.name: wl_notificationtimestamp
columns.comment: Timestamp used to send notification e-mails and show 'updated since last visit' markers. Set to NULL when the user visits the latest revision of the page, which means that they should be sent an e-mail on the next change.

indexes.name: wl_user
indexes.comment: Special:Watchlist

indexes.name: wl_namespace_title
indexes.comment: Special:Movepage (WatchedItemStore::duplicateEntry)

indexes.name: wl_user_notificationtimestamp
indexes.comment: ApiQueryWatchlistRaw changed filter

name: sites
comment: Holds all the sites known to the wiki.

columns.name: site_id
columns.comment: Numeric id of the site

columns.name: site_global_key
columns.comment: Global identifier for the site, ie 'enwiktionary'

columns.name: site_type
columns.comment: Type of the site, ie 'mediawiki'

columns.name: site_group
columns.comment: Group of the site, ie 'wikipedia'

columns.name: site_source
columns.comment: Source of the site data, ie 'local', 'wikidata', 'my-magical-repo'

columns.name: site_language
columns.comment: Language code of the sites primary language.

columns.name: site_protocol
columns.comment: Protocol of the site, ie 'http://', 'irc://', '//'. This field is an index for lookups and is build from type specific data in site_data.

columns.name: site_domain
columns.comment: Domain of the site in reverse order, ie 'org.mediawiki.www.'. This field is an index for lookups and is build from type specific data in site_data.

columns.name: site_data
columns.comment: Type dependent site data.

columns.name: site_forward
columns.comment: If site.tld/path/key:pageTitle should forward users to  the page on the actual site, where "key" is the local identifier.

columns.name: site_config
columns.comment: Type dependent site config. For instance if template transclusion should be allowed if it's a MediaWiki.

name: user_newtalk
comment: Stores notifications of user talk page changes, for the display of the 'you have new messages' box

columns.name: user_ip
columns.comment: If the user is an anonymous user their IP address is stored here since the user_id of 0 is ambiguous

columns.name: user_last_timestamp
columns.comment: The highest timestamp of revisions of the talk page viewed by this user

name: interwiki
comment: Recognized interwiki link prefixes

columns.name: iw_prefix
columns.comment: The interwiki prefix, (e.g. "Meatball", or the language prefix "de")

columns.name: iw_url
columns.comment: The URL of the wiki, with "$1" as a placeholder for an article name. Any spaces in the name will be transformed to underscores before insertion.

columns.name: iw_api
columns.comment: The URL of the file api.php

columns.name: iw_wikiid
columns.comment: The name of the database (for a connection to be established with LBFactory::getMainLB( 'wikiid' ))

columns.name: iw_local
columns.comment: A boolean value indicating whether the wiki is in this project (used, for example, to detect redirect loops)

columns.name: iw_trans
columns.comment: Boolean value indicating whether interwiki transclusions are allowed.

name: protected_titles
comment: Used for storing nonexistent pages that have been protected

name: externallinks
comment: Track links to external URLs

columns.name: el_from
columns.comment: page_id of the referring page

columns.name: el_to_domain_index
columns.comment: Indexable domain

columns.name: el_to_path
columns.comment: Path to the external link without considering the domain

name: ip_changes
comment: Every time an edit by a logged out user is saved, a row is created in ip_changes. This stores the IP as a hex representation so that we can more easily find edits within an IP range.

columns.name: ipc_rev_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to the revision table, also serves as the unique primary key

columns.name: ipc_rev_timestamp
columns.comment: The timestamp of the revision

columns.name: ipc_hex
columns.comment: Hex representation of the IP address, as returned by Wikimedia\IPUtils::toHex() For IPv4 it will resemble: ABCD1234 For IPv6: v6-ABCD1234000000000000000000000000 BETWEEN is then used to identify revisions within a given range

name: page_props
comment: Name/value pairs indexed by page_id

name: job
comment: Jobs performed by parallel apache threads or a command-line daemon

columns.name: job_cmd
columns.comment: Command name. Limited to 60 to prevent key length overflow

columns.name: job_namespace
columns.comment: Namespace to act on. Should be 0 if the command does not operate on a title

columns.name: job_title
columns.comment: Title to act on. Should be '' if the command does not operate on a title

columns.name: job_timestamp
columns.comment: Timestamp of when the job was inserted. NULL for jobs added before addition of the timestamp

columns.name: job_params
columns.comment: Any other parameters to the command. Stored as a PHP serialized array, or an empty string if there are no parameters

columns.name: job_random
columns.comment: Random, non-unique, number used for job acquisition (for lock concurrency)

columns.name: job_attempts
columns.comment: The number of times this job has been locked

columns.name: job_token
columns.comment: Field that conveys process locks on rows via process UUIDs

columns.name: job_token_timestamp
columns.comment: Timestamp when the job was locked

columns.name: job_sha1
columns.comment: Base 36 SHA1 of the job parameters relevant to detecting duplicates

name: slot_roles
comment: Normalization table for role names

indexes.name: role_name
indexes.comment: Index for looking up the internal ID of a role

name: content_models
comment: Normalization table for content model names

indexes.name: model_name
indexes.comment: Index for looking up the internal ID of a model

name: categorylinks
comment: Track category inclusions *used inline* This tracks a single level of category membership

columns.name: cl_from
columns.comment: Key to page_id of the page defined as a category member.

columns.name: cl_to
columns.comment: Name of the category. This is also the page_title of the category's description page; all such pages are in namespace 14 (NS_CATEGORY).

columns.name: cl_sortkey
columns.comment: A binary string obtained by applying a sortkey generation algorithm (Collation::getSortKey()) to page_title, or cl_sortkey_prefix . "\n" page_title if cl_sortkey_prefix is nonempty.

columns.name: cl_sortkey_prefix
columns.comment: A prefix for the raw sortkey manually specified by the user, either via [[Category:Foo|prefix]] or {{defaultsort:prefix}}.  If nonempty, it's concatenated with a line break followed by the page title before the sortkey conversion algorithm is run.  We store this so that we can update collations without reparsing all pages. Note: If you change the length of this field, you also need to change code in LinksUpdate.php. See T27254.

columns.name: cl_timestamp
columns.comment: This isn't really used at present. Provided for an optional sorting method by approximate addition time.

columns.name: cl_collation
columns.comment: Stores $wgCategoryCollation at the time cl_sortkey was generated.  This can be used to install new collation versions, tracking which rows are not yet updated.  '' means no collation, this is a legacy row that needs to be updated by updateCollation.php.  In the future, it might be possible to specify different collations per category.

columns.name: cl_type
columns.comment: Stores whether cl_from is a category, file, or other page, so we can paginate the three categories separately.  This only has to be updated when moving pages into or out of the category namespace, since file pages cannot be moved to other namespaces, nor can non-files be moved into the file namespace.

columns.name: cl_collation_id
columns.comment: FK to collation_id

columns.name: cl_target_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to linktarget.lt_id

indexes.name: cl_sortkey
indexes.comment: We always sort within a given category, and within a given type.  FIXME: Formerly this index didn't cover cl_type (since that didn't exist), so old callers won't be using an index: fix this?

indexes.name: cl_timestamp
indexes.comment: Used by the API (and some extensions)

indexes.name: cl_sortkey_id
indexes.comment: We always sort within a given category, and within a given type.  FIXME: Formerly this index didn't cover cl_type (since that didn't exist), so old callers won't be using an index: fix this?

indexes.name: cl_timestamp_id
indexes.comment: Used by the API (and some extensions)

columns.name: log_id
columns.comment: Log ID, for referring to this specific log entry, probably for deletion and such.

columns.name: log_type
columns.comment: Symbolic key for the general log type. The output format will be controlled by the log_action field.

columns.name: log_action
columns.comment: Symbolic key for the log action type.

columns.name: log_namespace
columns.comment: Key to the namespace of the page affected

columns.name: log_title
columns.comment: Key to the title of the page affected

columns.name: log_page
columns.comment: Key to the page affected

columns.name: log_comment_id
columns.comment: Key to comment_id. Comment summarizing the change.

columns.name: log_params
columns.comment: LF separated list (old system) or serialized PHP array (new system)

columns.name: log_deleted
columns.comment: rev_deleted for logs

indexes.name: log_type_time
indexes.comment: Special:Log type filter

indexes.name: log_actor_time
indexes.comment: Special:Log performer filter

indexes.name: log_page_time
indexes.comment: Special:Log title filter, log extract

indexes.name: log_times
indexes.comment: Special:Log unfiltered

indexes.name: log_actor_type_time
indexes.comment: Special:Log filter by performer and type

indexes.name: log_page_id_time
indexes.comment: Apparently just used for a few maintenance pages (findMissingFiles.php, Flow). Could be removed?

indexes.name: log_type_action
indexes.comment: Special:Log action filter

name: uploadstash
comment: Store information about newly uploaded files before they're moved into the actual filestore

columns.name: us_user
columns.comment: the user who uploaded the file.

columns.name: us_key
columns.comment: file key. this is how applications actually search for the file. this might go away, or become the primary key.

columns.name: us_orig_path
columns.comment: the original path

columns.name: us_path
columns.comment: the temporary path at which the file is actually stored

columns.name: us_source_type
columns.comment: which type of upload the file came from (sometimes)

columns.name: us_timestamp
columns.comment: the date/time on which the file was added

columns.name: us_chunk_inx
columns.comment: chunk counter starts at 0, current offset is stored in us_size

columns.name: us_props
columns.comment: Serialized file properties from FSFile::getProps()

columns.name: us_size
columns.comment: file size in bytes

columns.name: us_sha1
columns.comment: this hash comes from FSFile::getSha1Base36(), and is 31 characters

columns.name: us_media_type
columns.comment: Media type as defined by the MEDIATYPE_xxx constants, should duplicate definition in the image table

columns.name: us_image_width
columns.comment: image-specific properties

indexes.name: us_user
indexes.comment: sometimes there's a delete for all of a user's stuff.

indexes.name: us_key
indexes.comment: pick out files by key, enforce key uniqueness

indexes.name: us_timestamp
indexes.comment: the abandoned upload cleanup script needs this

name: filearchive
comment: Record of deleted file data

columns.name: fa_id
columns.comment: Unique row id

columns.name: fa_name
columns.comment: Original base filename; key to image.img_name, page.page_title, etc

columns.name: fa_archive_name
columns.comment: Filename of archived file, if an old revision

columns.name: fa_storage_group
columns.comment: Which storage bin (directory tree or object store) the file data is stored in. Should be 'deleted' for files that have been deleted; any other bin is not yet in use.

columns.name: fa_storage_key
columns.comment: SHA-1 of the file contents plus extension, used as a key for storage. eg 8f8a562add37052a1848ff7771a2c515db94baa9.jpg. If NULL, the file was missing at deletion time or has been purged from the archival storage.

columns.name: fa_deleted
columns.comment: Visibility of deleted revisions, bitfield

columns.name: fa_sha1
columns.comment: sha1 hash of file content

indexes.name: fa_name
indexes.comment: pick out by image name

indexes.name: fa_storage_group
indexes.comment: pick out dupe files

indexes.name: fa_deleted_timestamp
indexes.comment: sort by deletion time

indexes.name: fa_actor_timestamp
indexes.comment: sort by uploader

indexes.name: fa_sha1
indexes.comment: find file by sha1, 10 bytes will be enough for hashes to be indexed

name: text
comment: Holds text of individual page revisions. Field names are a holdover from the 'old' revisions table in MediaWiki 1.4 and earlier: an upgrade will transform that table into the 'text' table to minimize unnecessary churning and downtime. If upgrading, the other fields will be left unused. This table can also hold metadata of files if the metadata is too big to store in img_metadata, oi_metadata or fa_metadata.

columns.name: old_id
columns.comment: Unique text storage key number. Note that the 'oldid' parameter used in URLs does *not* refer to this number anymore, but to rev_id. content.content_address refers to this column. Also img_metadata, oi_metadata or fa_metadata can refer to this column when being used to store file metadata.

columns.name: old_text
columns.comment: Depending on the contents of the old_flags field, the text may be convenient plain text, or it may be funkily encoded.

columns.name: old_flags
columns.comment:
Comma-separated list of flags:
* gzip: text is compressed with PHP's gzdeflate() function.
* utf-8: text was stored as UTF-8. If $wgLegacyEncoding option is on, rows *without* this flag will be converted to UTF-8 transparently at load time. Note that due to a bug in a maintenance script, this flag may have been stored as 'utf8' in some cases (T18841).
* object: text field contained a serialized PHP object. The object either contains multiple versions compressed together to achieve a better compression ratio, or it refers to another row where the text can be found.
* external: text was stored in an external location specified by old_text. Any additional flags apply to the data stored at that URL, not the URL itself. The 'object' flag is *not* set for URLs of the form 'DB://cluster/id/itemid', because the external storage system itself decompresses these.

name: oldimage
comment: Previous revisions of uploaded files. Awkwardly, image rows have to be moved into this table at re-upload time.

columns.name: oi_name
columns.comment: Base filename: key to image.img_name

columns.name: oi_archive_name
columns.comment: Filename of the archived file. This is generally a timestamp and '!' prepended to the base name.

indexes.name: oi_name_archive_name
indexes.comment: oi_archive_name truncated to 14 to avoid key length overflow

indexes.name: oi_timestamp
indexes.comment: Used by Special:ListFiles

name: objectcache
comment: For a few generic cache operations if not using Memcached

name: block
comment: Blocks against user accounts, IP addresses and IP ranges.

columns.name: bl_id
columns.comment: Primary key.

columns.name: bl_target
columns.comment: The block target. Foreign key to block_target.bt_id.

columns.name: bl_by_actor
columns.comment: Actor who made the block.

columns.name: bl_reason_id
columns.comment: Key to comment_id. Text comment made by blocker.

columns.name: bl_timestamp
columns.comment: Creation (or refresh) date in standard YMDHMS form. IP blocks expire automatically.

columns.name: bl_anon_only
columns.comment: If set to 1, block applies only to logged-out users and temporary users.

columns.name: bl_create_account
columns.comment: Block prevents account creation from matching IP addresses

columns.name: bl_enable_autoblock
columns.comment: Block triggers autoblocks

columns.name: bl_expiry
columns.comment: Time at which the block will expire. May be "infinity"

columns.name: bl_deleted
columns.comment: If true, this block causes the username to be hidden, and the expiry must be infinite. This is denormalized into rev_deleted and the other deleted bitfields (T346716).

columns.name: bl_block_email
columns.comment: Block prevents user from accessing Special:Emailuser

columns.name: bl_allow_usertalk
columns.comment: Block allows user to edit their own talk page

columns.name: bl_parent_block_id
columns.comment: ID of the block that caused this block to exist. Autoblocks set this to the original block so that the original block being deleted also deletes the autoblocks.

columns.name: bl_sitewide
columns.comment: Block user from editing any page on the site (other than their own user talk page).

indexes.name: bl_timestamp
indexes.comment: Index for Special:BlockList

indexes.name: bl_target
indexes.comment: For searching by target

indexes.name: bl_expiry
indexes.comment: Index for table pruning

indexes.name: bl_parent_block_id
indexes.comment: Index for removing autoblocks when a parent block is removed

name: block_target
comment: The targets of blocks

columns.name: bt_id
columns.comment: Primary key.

columns.name: bt_address
columns.comment: Blocked IP address or range in dotted-quad form, or null for a user block. If bt_auto is 1 then the address is private.

columns.name: bt_user
columns.comment: Blocked user ID or null for IP blocks.

columns.name: bt_user_text
columns.comment: The name of the blocked user, or null for IP blocks. For Special:BlockList sorting (T48013).

columns.name: bt_auto
columns.comment: Indicates that the IP address was banned because a banned user accessed a page through it. If this is 1, ipb_address will be hidden, and the block identified by block ID number.

columns.name: bt_range_start
columns.comment: Start of an address range, in hexadecimal. Null for single-IP and user blocks.

columns.name: bt_range_end
columns.comment: End of an address range, in hexadecimal. Null for single-IP and user blocks.

columns.name: bt_ip_hex
columns.comment: If the block is for a single IP, this is the IP address in hexadecimal. If the block is for a range, the start of the range in hexadecimal, identical to bt_range_start.

columns.name: bt_count
columns.comment: The number of block rows associated with this target.

indexes.name: bt_address
indexes.comment: For finding single IP blocks and for Special:BlockList searching.

indexes.name: bt_ip_user_text
indexes.comment: For sorting Special:BlockList by target (T48013)

indexes.name: bt_range
indexes.comment: For querying whether an IP address is in any range

indexes.name: bt_user
indexes.comment: For querying whether a logged-in user is blocked

name: image
comment: Uploaded images and other files.

columns.name: img_name
columns.comment: Filename. This is also the title of the associated description page, which will be in namespace 6 (NS_FILE).

columns.name: img_size
columns.comment: File size in bytes.

columns.name: img_width
columns.comment: For images, width in pixels.

columns.name: img_height
columns.comment: For images, height in pixels.

columns.name: img_metadata
columns.comment: Extracted Exif metadata stored as a json array (new system) or serialized PHP array (old system). The json array can contain an address in the text table or external storage.

columns.name: img_bits
columns.comment: For images, bits per pixel if known.

columns.name: img_media_type
columns.comment: Media type as defined by the MEDIATYPE_xxx constants

columns.name: img_major_mime
columns.comment: major part of a MIME media type as defined by IANA see https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/ for "chemical" cf. http://dx.doi.org/10.1021/ci9803233 by the ACS

columns.name: img_minor_mime
columns.comment: minor part of a MIME media type as defined by IANA the minor parts are not required to adhere to any standard but should be consistent throughout the database see https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/

columns.name: img_description_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to comment table, which contains the description field as entered by the uploader. This is displayed in image upload history and logs.

columns.name: img_actor
columns.comment: actor_id of the uploader.

columns.name: img_timestamp
columns.comment: Time of the upload.

columns.name: img_sha1
columns.comment: SHA-1 content hash in base-36

indexes.name: img_actor_timestamp
indexes.comment: Used by Special:Newimages and ApiQueryAllImages

indexes.name: img_size
indexes.comment: Used by Special:ListFiles for sort-by-size

indexes.name: img_timestamp
indexes.comment: Used by Special:Newimages and Special:ListFiles

indexes.name: img_sha1
indexes.comment: Used in API and duplicate search

indexes.name: img_media_mime
indexes.comment: Used to get media of one type

name: recentchanges
comment: Primarily a summary table for Special:RecentChanges, this table contains some additional info on edits from the last few days

columns.name: rc_actor
columns.comment: As in revision

columns.name: rc_namespace
columns.comment: When pages are renamed, their RC entries do _not_ change.

columns.name: rc_comment_id
columns.comment: as in revision...

columns.name: rc_bot
columns.comment: Edits by user accounts with the 'bot' rights key are marked with a 1 here, and will be hidden from the default view.

columns.name: rc_new
columns.comment: Set if this change corresponds to a page creation

columns.name: rc_cur_id
columns.comment: Key to page_id (was cur_id prior to 1.5). This will keep links working after moves while retaining the at-the-time name in the changes list.

columns.name: rc_this_oldid
columns.comment: rev_id of the given revision

columns.name: rc_last_oldid
columns.comment: rev_id of the prior revision, for generating diff links.

columns.name: rc_type
columns.comment: The type of change entry (RC_EDIT,RC_NEW,RC_LOG,RC_EXTERNAL)

columns.name: rc_source
columns.comment: The source of the change entry (replaces rc_type) default of '' is temporary, needed for initial migration

columns.name: rc_patrolled
columns.comment: If the Recent Changes Patrol option is enabled, users may mark edits as having been reviewed to remove a warning flag on the RC list. A value of 1 indicates the page has been reviewed.

columns.name: rc_ip
columns.comment: Recorded IP address the edit was made from, if the $wgPutIPinRC option is enabled.

columns.name: rc_old_len
columns.comment: Text length in characters before the edit

columns.name: rc_new_len
columns.comment: Text length in characters after the edit

columns.name: rc_deleted
columns.comment: Visibility of recent changes items, bitfield

columns.name: rc_logid
columns.comment: Value corresponding to log_id, specific log entries

columns.name: rc_log_type
columns.comment: Store log type info here, or null

columns.name: rc_log_action
columns.comment: Store log action or null

columns.name: rc_params
columns.comment: Log params

indexes.name: rc_timestamp
indexes.comment: Special:Recentchanges

indexes.name: rc_namespace_title_timestamp
indexes.comment: Special:Watchlist

indexes.name: rc_cur_id
indexes.comment: Special:Recentchangeslinked when finding changes in pages linked from a page

indexes.name: rc_new_name_timestamp
indexes.comment: Special:Newpages

indexes.name: rc_ip
indexes.comment: Blank unless $wgPutIPinRC=true (false at WMF), possibly used by extensions, but mostly replaced by CheckUser.

indexes.name: rc_ns_actor
indexes.comment: Probably intended for Special:NewPages namespace filter

indexes.name: rc_actor
indexes.comment: SiteStats active user count, Special:ActiveUsers, Special:NewPages user filter

indexes.name: rc_name_type_patrolled_timestamp
indexes.comment: ApiQueryRecentChanges (T140108)

indexes.name: rc_this_oldid
indexes.comment: Article.php and friends (T139012)

name: archive
comment: Archive area for deleted pages and their revisions. These may be viewed (and restored) by admins through the Special:Undelete interface.

columns.name: ar_id
columns.comment: Primary key

columns.name: ar_namespace
columns.comment: Copied from page_namespace

columns.name: ar_title
columns.comment: Copied from page_title

columns.name: ar_comment_id
columns.comment: Basic revision stuff.

columns.name: ar_actor
columns.comment: Basic revision stuff.

columns.name: ar_timestamp
columns.comment: Basic revision stuff.

columns.name: ar_minor_edit
columns.comment: Basic revision stuff.

columns.name: ar_rev_id
columns.comment: Copied from rev_id.

columns.name: ar_deleted
columns.comment: Copied from rev_deleted. Although this may be raised during deletion. Users with the "suppressrevision" right may "archive" and "suppress" content in a single action. @since 1.10

columns.name: ar_len
columns.comment: Copied from rev_len, length of this revision in bytes. @since 1.10

columns.name: ar_page_id
columns.comment: Copied from page_id. Restoration will attempt to use this as page ID if no current page with the same name exists. Otherwise, the revisions will be restored under the current page. Can be used for manual undeletion by developers if multiple pages by the same name were archived. @since 1.11 Older entries will have NULL.

columns.name: ar_parent_id
columns.comment: Copied from rev_parent_id. @since 1.13

columns.name: ar_sha1
columns.comment: Copied from rev_sha1, SHA-1 text content hash in base-36 @since 1.19

indexes.name: ar_name_title_timestamp
indexes.comment: Index for Special:Undelete to page through deleted revisions

indexes.name: ar_actor_timestamp
indexes.comment: Index for Special:DeletedContributions

indexes.name: ar_revid_uniq
indexes.comment: Index for linking archive rows with tables that normally link with revision rows, such as change_tag.

name: page
comment: Core of the wiki: each page has an entry here which identifies it by title and contains some essential metadata.

columns.name: page_id
columns.comment: Unique identifier number. The page_id will be preserved across edits and rename operations, but not deletions and recreations.

columns.name: page_namespace
columns.comment: A page name is broken into a namespace and a title. The namespace keys are UI-language-independent constants, defined in includes/Defines.php

columns.name: page_title
columns.comment: The rest of the title, as text. Spaces are transformed into underscores in title storage.

columns.name: page_is_redirect
columns.comment: 1 indicates the article is a redirect. If so, there is a row in the `redirect` table with rd_from=page_id, which contains the redirect target.

columns.name: page_is_new
columns.comment: 1 indicates this is a new entry, with only one edit. Not all pages with one edit are new pages.

columns.name: page_random
columns.comment: Random value between 0 and 1, used for Special:Randompage

columns.name: page_touched
columns.comment: This timestamp is updated whenever the page changes in a way requiring it to be re-rendered, invalidating caches. Aside from editing this includes permission changes, creation or deletion of linked pages, and alteration of contained templates.

columns.name: page_links_updated
columns.comment: This timestamp is updated whenever a page is re-parsed and it has all the link tracking tables updated for it. This is useful for de-duplicating expensive backlink update jobs.

columns.name: page_latest
columns.comment: Handy key to revision.rev_id of the current revision. This may be 0 during page creation, but that shouldn't happen outside of a transaction... hopefully.

columns.name: page_len
columns.comment: Uncompressed length in bytes of the page's current source text.

columns.name: page_content_model
columns.comment: content model, see CONTENT_MODEL_XXX constants

columns.name: page_lang
columns.comment: Page content language

indexes.name: page_name_title
indexes.comment: The title index. Care must be taken to always specify a namespace when by title, so that the index is used. Even listing all known namespaces with IN() is better than omitting page_namespace from the WHERE clause.

indexes.name: page_random
indexes.comment: Index for Special:Random

indexes.name: page_len
indexes.comment: Questionable utility, used by ProofreadPage, possibly DynamicPageList. ApiQueryAllPages unconditionally filters on namespace and so hopefully does not use it.

indexes.name: page_redirect_namespace_len
indexes.comment: The index for Special:Shortpages and Special:Longpages. Also SiteStats::articles() in 'comma' counting mode, MessageCache::loadFromDB().

name: user
comment: The user table contains basic account information, authentication keys, etc. Some multi-wiki sites may share a single central user table between separate wikis using the $wgSharedDB setting. Note that even when an external authentication plugin is in use, user table entries still need to be created to store preferences and to key tracking information in the other tables

columns.name: user_name
columns.comment: Usernames must be unique, must not be in the form of an IP address. They should not allow slashes or case conflicts. Spaces are allowed, and are not converted to underscores like in page titles.

columns.name: user_real_name
columns.comment: Optional 'real name' to be displayed in credit listings

columns.name: user_password
columns.comment: Password hashes

columns.name: user_newpassword
columns.comment: When using 'mail me a new password', a random password is generated and the hash stored here. The previous password is left in place until someone actually logs in with the new password, at which point the hash is moved to user_password and the old password is invalidated.

columns.name: user_newpass_time
columns.comment: Timestamp of the last time when a new password was sent, for throttling and expiring purposes. Emailed passwords will expire $wgNewPasswordExpiry (a week) after being set. If user_newpass_time is NULL (eg. created by mail) it doesn't expire.

columns.name: user_email
columns.comment: User email. Non public info.

columns.name: user_touched
columns.comment: If the browser sends an If-Modified-Since header, a 304 response is suppressed if the value in this field for the current user is later than the value in the IMS header. That is, this field is an invalidation timestamp for the browser cache of logged-in users. Among other things, it is used to prevent pages generated for a previously logged in user from being displayed after a session expiry followed by a fresh login.

columns.name: user_token
columns.comment: A pseudorandomly generated value that is stored in a cookie when the 'remember password' feature is used (previously, a hash of the password was used, but this was vulnerable to cookie-stealing attacks)

columns.name: user_email_authenticated
columns.comment: Initially NULL; when a user's e-mail address has been validated by returning with a mailed token, this is set to the current timestamp.

columns.name: user_email_token
columns.comment: Randomly generated token created when the e-mail address is set and a confirmation test mail sent.

columns.name: user_email_token_expires
columns.comment: Expiration date for the user_email_token.

columns.name: user_registration
columns.comment: Timestamp of account registration. Accounts predating this schema addition may contain NULL.

columns.name: user_editcount
columns.comment: Count of edits and edit-like actions. Not intended to be an accurate copy of 'COUNT(*) WHERE rev_actor refers to a user's actor_id'. May contain NULL for old accounts if batch-update scripts haven't been run, as well as listing deleted edits and other myriad ways it could be out of sync. Meant primarily for heuristic checks to give an impression of whether the account has been used much.

columns.name: user_password_expires
columns.comment: Expiration date for user password.

columns.name: user_is_temp
columns.comment: This exists to allow temporary users to be identified from the database only, by external applications, and is not for use within MediaWiki (see T333223). A boolean value representing whether the user is a temporary user. Zero if any type of user other than a temporary user.

name: user_autocreate_serial
comment: Table for sequential name generation for auto-created temporary users

columns.name: uas_shard
columns.comment: The segment of ID space, ID mod N, referred to by this row

columns.name: uas_year
columns.comment: The year to which this row belongs, if $wgAutoCreateTempUser['serialProvider']['useYear'] is true.

columns.name: uas_value
columns.comment: The maximum allocated ID value

name: revision
comment: Every edit of a page creates also a revision row. This stores metadata about the revision, and a reference to the text storage backend.

columns.name: rev_id
columns.comment: Unique ID to identify each revision

columns.name: rev_page
columns.comment: Key to page_id. This should never be invalid

columns.name: rev_comment_id
columns.comment: Key to comment.comment_id. Comment summarizing the change

columns.name: rev_actor
columns.comment: Key to actor.actor_id of the user or IP who made this edit

columns.name: rev_timestamp
columns.comment: Timestamp of when revision was created

columns.name: rev_minor_edit
columns.comment: Records whether the user marked the 'minor edit' checkbox. Many automated edits are marked as minor

columns.name: rev_deleted
columns.comment: Restrictions on who can access this revision

columns.name: rev_len
columns.comment: Length of this revision in bytes

columns.name: rev_parent_id
columns.comment: Key to revision.rev_id. This field is used to add support for a tree structure (The Adjacency List Model)

columns.name: rev_sha1
columns.comment: SHA-1 text content hash in base-36

indexes.name: rev_timestamp
indexes.comment: Used by ApiQueryAllRevisions

indexes.name: rev_page_timestamp
indexes.comment: History index

indexes.name: rev_actor_timestamp
indexes.comment: User contributions index

indexes.name: rev_page_actor_timestamp
indexes.comment: Credits index. This is scanned in order to compile credits lists for pages, in ApiQueryContributors. Also for ApiQueryRevisions if rvuser is specified

name: searchindex
comment: search backend, this is actively used in MySQL but created and not used in Postgres while there are plans to use it in the future (T220450). This table must be MyISAM in MySQL; InnoDB does not support the needed fulltext index.

columns.name: si_page
columns.comment: Key to page_id

columns.name: si_title
columns.comment: Munged version of title

columns.name: si_text
columns.comment: Munged version of body text

name: linktarget
comment: Holds immutable records of link targets, used mostly for links tables.

columns.name: lt_id
columns.comment: primary key

columns.name: lt_namespace
columns.comment: Namespace of the link target

columns.name: lt_title
columns.comment: Text part of link target excluding namespace

name: file
comment: Uploaded images and other files.

columns.name: file_id
columns.comment: primary key

columns.name: file_name
columns.comment: Name of the file

columns.name: file_latest
columns.comment: FK to fr_id

columns.name: file_type
columns.comment: FK to filetypes.ft_id

columns.name: file_deleted
columns.comment: Whether the file is deleted

indexes.name: file_name
indexes.comment: To find files based on their name

indexes.name: file_latest
indexes.comment: To allow join with filerevision table

name: filerevision
comment: Revisions of the files

columns.name: fr_id
columns.comment: primary key

columns.name: fr_file
columns.comment: FK to file_id

columns.name: fr_size
columns.comment: File size in bytes.

columns.name: fr_width
columns.comment: For images, width in pixels.

columns.name: fr_height
columns.comment: For images, height in pixels.

columns.name: fr_metadata
columns.comment: Extracted Exif metadata stored as a json array (new system) or serialized PHP array (old system). The json array can contain an address in the text table or external storage.

columns.name: fr_bits
columns.comment: For images, bits per pixel if known.

columns.name: fr_description_id
columns.comment: Foreign key to comment table, which contains the description field as entered by the uploader. This is displayed in image upload history and logs.

columns.name: fr_actor
columns.comment: actor_id of the uploader.

columns.name: fr_timestamp
columns.comment: Time of the upload.

columns.name: fr_sha1
columns.comment: SHA-1 content hash in base-36

columns.name: fr_archive_name
columns.comment: Filename of the archived file. This is generally a timestamp and '!' prepended to the base name.

columns.name: fr_deleted
columns.comment: Whether the file is deleted

indexes.name: fr_actor_timestamp
indexes.comment: Used by Special:Newimages and ApiQueryAllImages

indexes.name: fr_size
indexes.comment: Used by Special:ListFiles for sort-by-size

indexes.name: fr_timestamp
indexes.comment: Used by Special:Newimages and Special:ListFiles

indexes.name: fr_sha1
indexes.comment: Used in API and duplicate search

indexes.name: fr_file
indexes.comment: To find all filerevisions belonging to one file

name: filetypes
comment: Valid file types

columns.name: ft_id
columns.comment: primary key

columns.name: ft_media_type
columns.comment: Media type as defined by the MEDIATYPE_xxx constants

columns.name: ft_major_mime
columns.comment: major part of a MIME media type as defined by IANA see https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/ for "chemical" cf. http://dx.doi.org/10.1021/ci9803233 by the ACS

columns.name: ft_minor_mime
columns.comment: minor part of a MIME media type as defined by IANA the minor parts are not required to adhere to any standard but should be consistent throughout the database see https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/

indexes.name: ft_media_mime
indexes.comment: Used to get media of one type

name: collation
comment: Normalization table for collation names

indexes.name: collation_name
indexes.comment: Index for looking up the internal ID of a collation
